projectName: Sam's Club US Online Photo Center
desc: In the early stages of my career in 2006 at PNI Media, I was involved in a project for Sam's Club, focusing on their legacy Online Photocenter website. As the front-end developer, I collaborated closely with back-end developers and UI/UX designers to enhance the user experience by implementing responsive design and refreshing the user interface. The Sam's Club Online Photocenter included the main photo site, as well as sub-sites for greeting cards and stationery. Originally built in Java, the platform eventually underwent migration to ASP.net and incorporated jQuery.

imgSrc.alt: Desktop layout of Samsclub Online Photo Center
Tablet layout of Samsclub Online Photo Center
Mobile layout of Samsclub Online Photo Center
Samsclub Online Photo Center Stationery search results page

desc: In 2010, PNI Media collaborated with Costco to integrate print web services into their Online Photo Centers. As a front-end developer collaborating with back-end developers and UI/UX designers, I played a crucial role in implementing this integration for both the Canadian and US markets. Working on an enterprise-scale project, my responsibilities included developing the front end of their main photo sites and subsidiary greeting card sites. The project utilized ASP.net, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery as its primary technologies. Later, in 2018, I spearheaded accessibility initiatives, ensuring the integration of WCAG features across all their websites.

desc: In my role as a front-end developer, I contributed to the creation of a dynamic Product Pricing component utilizing ReactJS, NextJS, TypeScript, and CSS modules. This component served as a demonstration of seamless integration with the Bloomreach headless CMS. With a focus on full responsiveness, enhanced semantic HTML structure, and a user-friendly CMS integration approach, the component was designed to elevate the overall user experience.
